thread.title: Everton 4-0 Manchester City player ratings: Who was YOUR man of the match at Goodison Park?
thread.title_full: Everton 4-0 Manchester City player ratings: Who was YOUR man of the match at Goodison Park?

author: John Cross
title: Everton 4-0 Manchester City player ratings: Who was YOUR man of the match at Goodison Park?
text:
Everton's Tom Davies celebrates scoring their third goal (Photo: Reuters) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City's title hopes are all but over after being swept aside by Everton at Goodison Park. 
Just a fortnight after their defeat at Liverpool, an even more abject performance saw their Premier League ambition go up in smoke, as they were beaten 4-0 by the Toffees . 
Pep Guardiola's side were taken apart by a rampart Everton, who weathered an early storm, before taking a grip on the game through a brilliant goal from Romelu Lukaku after a slick passing move. 
Then Kevin Mirallas struck again just a minute after the break to totally deflate City – who seemed to give up after that blow. Lukaku fires home for Everton's opener (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Mirallas drives home for Everton's second (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
And their inept second half display, where they looked shattered and totally lacking in ideas, was put into context late on, as youngster Tom Davies capped a fine display with a third, before debutant Ademola Lookman fired home in stoppage time. 
So who impressed on Merseyside? And who floundered? Here are John Cross' player ratings: Lookman wrapped it up in stoppage time (Photo: REUTERS) Everton 
Made a terrific and crucial block from Silva. Lucky not to concede a penalty. Seamus Coleman 7 
Has remained consistent this season and full of energy again. Solid. Mason Holgate 7 
Booked. Looks a real prospect. Some outstanding blocks and interceptions. Holgate slides in on Sterling (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Ashley Williams 7 
Some scary moments in the first half, but generally marshalled the defence well. Ramiro Funes Mori 6 
Enjoys stepping out of defence but also gets dragged horribly out of position. Ramiro Funes Mori challenges Raheem Sterling (Photo: Reuters) Leighton Baines 7 
Enjoying brilliant renaissance as he defended and got forward well. Gareth Barry 7 
Provided a steady head and composure in midfield. Still going strong. Tom Davies 8 
Hair straight out of a 90s boyband, he was terrific. And scored first senior goal. A delicious finish from Davies (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Ross Barkley 7 
Crowd turned the first (and only) time he gave the ball away. Two assists. Kevin Mirallas 8 
Great assist for the opener and then brilliant finish for the second. Excellent. Romelu Lukaku 8 MOTM 
Fantastic finish for Everton opener. His power bullied City’s defence. Another goal for the Belgian (Photo: Getty Images) 
Subs used: Schneiderlin 7 (Mirallas, 64), McCarthy 6 (Barry, 73), Lookman 7 (Barkley 89) 
Subs not used: Jagielka, Lennon, McCarthy, Valencia, Stekelenburg. Man City Claudio Bravo 5 
Looks vulnerable in every game. Neither a sweeper or a keeper. Shaky. Claudio Bravo fails to saves Kevin Mirallas's shot giving Everton a 2-0 lead (Photo: Getty Images) Bacary Sagna 6 
Saw a header cleared off the line and was the better of City’s full backs. Nicolas Otamendi 5 
Often dragged out of position by Everton’s movement. Uncomfortable game. John Stones 7 
Booed on his return. Did OK but it is hard playing in this City defence. Gael Clichy 5 
Gave the ball away horribly in the build-up to Everton’s opener. Pablo Zabaleta 5 
City spend so much money and end up with Zabaleta in midfield. Hooked early. Zabaleta struggled in midfield (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Yaya Toure 6 
Still possesses great quality but you can’t play him and Zabaleta together. David Silva 6 
Booked. Some quality moments in the first half but needed to be far more ruthless. Kevin De Bruyne 7 
Good performance particularly first half. Full of ideas despite the result De Bruyne was City's most likely man in attack (Photo: Getty Images) Raheem Sterling 6 
Long range shot hit the post, unlucky not to get a penalty and was generally lively. Sergio Aguero 6 
Went close on numerous occasions. Needed to be far more ruthless and clinical. 
Subs used: Iheanacho 6 (Zabaleta, 62) 
Subs not used: Kolarov, Caballero, Navas, Delph, Sané, I, García. Like us on Facebook
